description: The first CRM designed by salespeople, for salespeople. Do more to grow your business.
name: pipedrive
title: Pipedrive

actions.description: Returns all deals.
actions.name: getDeals

properties.description: Deals matching the given user will be returned. However, `filter_id` and `owned_by_you` takes precedence over `user_id` when supplied.
properties.name: user_id
properties.label: User

properties.description: Filter to use.
properties.name: filter_id
properties.label: Filter

properties.description: Deals within the given stage will be returned.
properties.name: stage_id
properties.label: Stage

properties.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma. Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).
properties.name: sort
properties.label: Sort

actions.title: Get deals

actions.description: Adds a new deal.
actions.name: addDeal

properties.description: The title of the deal
properties.name: title
properties.label: Title

properties.description: The value of the deal.
properties.name: value
properties.label: Value

properties.description: The currency of the deal. If omitted, currency will be set to the default currency of the authorized user.
properties.name: currency
properties.label: Currency

properties.description: User which will be the owner of the  created deal. If not provided, the user making the request will be used.
properties.name: user_id
properties.label: User

properties.description: Person which this deal will be linked to. This property is required unless `org_id` is specified.
properties.name: person_id
properties.label: Person

properties.description: Organization which this deal will be linked to. This property is required unless `person_id` is specified.
properties.name: org_id
properties.label: Organization

properties.description: Pipeline this deal will be added to. By default, the deal will be added to the first stage of the specified pipeline. Please note that `pipeline_id` and `stage_id` should not be used together as `pipeline_id` will be ignored.
properties.name: pipeline_id
properties.label: Pipeline

properties.description: Stage this deal will be added to. Please note that a pipeline will be assigned automatically based on the `stage_id`. If omitted, the deal will be placed in the first stage of the default pipeline.
properties.name: stage_id
properties.label: Stage

properties.description: The expected close date of the deal.
properties.name: expected_close_date
properties.label: Expected Close Date

properties.description: The success probability percentage of the deal. Used/shown only when `deal_probability` for the pipeline of the deal is enabled.
properties.name: probability
properties.label: Probability

properties.description: The optional message about why the deal was lost.
properties.name: lost_reason
properties.label: Lost Reason

actions.title: Add deal

actions.description: Searches all deals by title, notes and/or custom fields.
actions.name: searchDeals

properties.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.
properties.name: term
properties.label: Term

properties.description: A comma-separated string array. The fields to perform the search from. Defaults to all of them.
properties.name: fields
properties.label: Fields

properties.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. It is not case sensitive.
properties.name: exact_match
properties.label: Exact Match

properties.description: Will filter deals by the provided person.
properties.name: person_id
properties.label: Person

properties.description: Will filter deals by the provided organization.
properties.name: organization_id
properties.label: Organization

properties.description: Will filter deals by the provided specific status.
properties.name: status
properties.label: Status

properties.description: Supports including optional fields in the results which are not provided by default.
properties.name: include_fields
properties.label: Include Fields

actions.title: Search deals

actions.description: Marks a deal as deleted. After 30 days, the deal will be permanently deleted.
actions.name: deleteDeal

properties.description: Deal to delete
properties.name: id
properties.label: Deal

actions.title: Delete deal

actions.description: Returns the details of a specific deal.
actions.name: getDealDetails
actions.title: Get details of a deal

actions.description: Returns multiple leads. Leads are sorted by the time they were created, from oldest to newest.
actions.name: getLeads

properties.description: Filtering based on the archived status of a lead.
properties.name: archived_status
properties.label: Archived Status

properties.description: Leads matching the given user will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `owner_id` when supplied.
properties.name: owner_id
properties.label: Owner

properties.description: If supplied, only leads matching the given person will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `person_id` when supplied.
properties.name: person_id
properties.label: Person

properties.description: If supplied, only leads matching the given organization will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `organization_id` when supplied.
properties.name: organization_id
properties.label: Organization

properties.description: Filter to use
properties.name: filter_id
properties.label: Filter

properties.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma. Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).
properties.name: sort
properties.label: Sort

actions.title: Get leads

actions.description: Creates a lead. A lead always has to be linked to a person or an organization or both.
actions.name: addLead

properties.description: The name of the lead.
properties.name: title
properties.label: Title

properties.description: User which will be the owner of the created lead.
properties.name: owner_id
properties.label: Owner

properties.description: Lead labels which will be associated with the lead.
properties.name: label_ids
properties.label: Lead   Labels

properties.description: Person which this lead will be linked to.
properties.name: person_id
properties.label: Person

properties.description: Organization which this lead will be linked to.
properties.name: organization_id
properties.label: Organization

properties.description: The potential value of the lead
properties.name: value
properties.label: Value

properties.description: The date of when the deal which will be created from the lead is expected to be closed. In ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
properties.name: expected_close_date
properties.label: Expected Close Date

actions.title: Add lead

actions.description: Deletes a specific lead.
actions.name: deleteLead

properties.description: The ID of the lead
properties.name: id
properties.label: Lead

actions.title: Delete lead

actions.description: Returns details of a specific lead.
actions.name: getLeadDetails
actions.title: Get lead details

actions.description: Searches all leads by title, notes and/or custom fields.
actions.name: searchLeads

properties.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.
properties.name: term
properties.label: Term

properties.description: A comma-separated string array. The fields to perform the search from. Defaults to all of them.
properties.name: fields
properties.label: Fields

properties.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. It is not case sensitive.
properties.name: exact_match
properties.label: Exact Match

properties.description: Will filter leads by the provided person ID.
properties.name: person_id
properties.label: Person

properties.description: Will filter leads by the provided organization ID.
properties.name: organization_id
properties.label: Organization

properties.description: Supports including optional fields in the results which are not provided by default.
properties.name: include_fields
properties.label: Include Fields

actions.title: Search leads

actions.description: Returns all organizations.
actions.name: getOrganizations

properties.description: Organizations owned by the given user will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `user_id` when both are supplied.
properties.name: user_id
properties.label: Owner

properties.description: Filter to use
properties.name: filter_id
properties.label: Filter

properties.description: Organizations whose name starts with the specified letter will be returned (case insensitive)
properties.name: first_char
properties.label: First   Characters

properties.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma (`field_name_1ASC`, `field_name_2 DESC`). Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).
properties.name: sort
properties.label: Sort

actions.title: Get all organizations

actions.description: Adds a new organization.
actions.name: addOrganization

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.name: name
properties.label: Name

properties.description: User who will be marked as the owner of this organization.
properties.name: owner_id
properties.label: Owner Id

actions.title: Add an organization

actions.description: Searches all organizations by name, address, notes and/or custom fields. This endpoint is a wrapper of /v1/itemSearch with a narrower OAuth scope.
actions.name: searchOrganization

properties.description: The search term to look for. Minimum 2 characters (or 1 if using `exact_match`). Please note that the search term has to be URL encoded.
properties.name: term
properties.label: Term

properties.description: A comma-separated string array. The fields to perform the search from. Defaults to all of them.
properties.name: fields
properties.label: Fields

properties.description: When enabled, only full exact matches against the given term are returned. It is not case sensitive.
properties.name: exact_match
properties.label: Exact Match

actions.title: Search organizations

properties.label: Organization

properties.description: Persons owned by the given user will be returned. However, `filter_id` takes precedence over `user_id` when both are supplied.

properties.label: Filter

properties.description: Persons whose name starts with the specified letter will be returned (case insensitive)
properties.name: first_char
properties.label: First   Characters

properties.description: The field names and sorting mode separated by a comma. Only first-level field keys are supported (no nested keys).
properties.name: sort
